did.abstract: This collection includes letters, notes, a ticket for lifetime admission to the New York Gallery of Arts, and a memorial poem honoring artist Walter Libbey. Materials date from 1847 to 1852.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Bessie C. Matthews, date unknown. Formally accessioned in 1978.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This small collection is housed in a single folder with no particular arrangement.

bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p: Born in Albany, artist Walter Libbey (1829-1852) came to Brooklyn circa 1830. His death at a young age was due to tuberculosis.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Walter Libbey papers, 1978.100, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level. This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2024.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection includes letters, notes, a ticket for lifetime admission to the New York Gallery of Arts, and a memorial poem honoring artist Walter Libbey. Materials date from 1847 to 1852.
